1532
1533class MrviewOutputs(typing.NamedTuple):
1534    """
1535    Output object returned when calling `mrview(...)`.
1536    """
1537    root: OutputPathType
1538    """Output root folder. This is the root folder for all outputs."""
1539
1540
1541def mrview(
1542    image: list[InputPathType] | None = None,
1543    mode: list[MrviewMode] | None = None,
1544    load: list[MrviewLoad] | None = None,
1545    reset: list[MrviewReset] | None = None,
1546    fov: list[MrviewFov] | None = None,
1547    focus: list[MrviewFocus] | None = None,
1548    target: list[MrviewTarget] | None = None,
1549    voxel: list[MrviewVoxel] | None = None,
1550    volume: list[MrviewVolume] | None = None,
1551    plane: list[MrviewPlane] | None = None,
1552    lock: list[MrviewLock] | None = None,
1553    select_image: list[MrviewSelectImage] | None = None,
1554    autoscale: list[MrviewAutoscale] | None = None,
1555    interpolation: list[MrviewInterpolation] | None = None,
1556    colourmap: list[MrviewColourmap] | None = None,
1557    noannotations: list[MrviewNoannotations] | None = None,

1600    capture_folder: list[MrviewCaptureFolder] | None = None,

1603    info: bool = False,
1604    quiet: bool = False,
1605    debug: bool = False,
1606    force: bool = False,
1607    nthreads: int | None = None,
1608    config: list[MrviewConfig] | None = None,
1609    help_: bool = False,
1610    version: bool = False,
1611    runner: Runner | None = None,
1612) -> MrviewOutputs:
1613    """
1614    mrview by J-Donald Tournier (jdtournier@gmail.com), Dave Raffelt
1615    (david.raffelt@florey.edu.au), Robert E. Smith (robert.smith@florey.edu.au),
1616    Rami Tabbara (rami.tabbara@florey.edu.au), Max Pietsch
1617    (maximilian.pietsch@kcl.ac.uk), Thijs Dhollander (thijs.dhollander@gmail.com).
1618    
1619    The MRtrix image viewer.
1620    
1621    Any images listed as arguments will be loaded and available through the
1622    image menu, with the first listed displayed initially. Any subsequent
1623    command-line options will be processed as if the corresponding action had
1624    been performed through the GUI.
1625    
1626    Note that because images loaded as arguments (i.e. simply listed on the
1627    command-line) are opened before the GUI is shown, subsequent actions to be
1628    performed via the various command-line options must appear after the last
1629    argument. This is to avoid confusion about which option will apply to which
1630    image. If you need fine control over this, please use the -load or
1631    -select_image options. For example:
1632    
1633    $ mrview -load image1.mif -interpolation 0 -load image2.mif -interpolation 0
1634    
1635    or
1636    
1637    $ mrview image1.mif image2.mif -interpolation 0 -select_image 2
1638    -interpolation 0
1639    
1640    References:
1641    
1642    Tournier, J.-D.; Calamante, F. & Connelly, A. MRtrix: Diffusion tractography
1643    in crossing fiber regions. Int. J. Imaging Syst. Technol., 2012, 22, 53-66.
1644    
1645    More information:
1646    https://mrtrix.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/commands/mrview.html
1647    
1648    Args:
1649        image: An image to be loaded.
1650        mode: Switch to view mode specified by the integer index, as per the\
1651            view menu.
1652        load: Load image specified and make it current.
1653        reset: Reset the view according to current image. This resets the FOV,\
1654            projection and focus.
1655        fov: Set the field of view, in mm.
1656        focus: Either set the position of the crosshairs in scanner\
1657            coordinates, with the new position supplied as a comma-separated list\
1658            of floating-point values or show or hide the focus cross hair using a\
1659            boolean value as argument.
1660        target: Set the target location for the viewing window (the scanner\
1661            coordinate that will appear at the centre of the viewing window.
1662        voxel: Set the position of the crosshairs in voxel coordinates,\
1663            relative the image currently displayed. The new position should be\
1664            supplied as a comma-separated list of floating-point values.
1665        volume: Set the volume index for the image displayed, as a\
1666            comma-separated list of integers.
1667        plane: Set the viewing plane, according to the mappping 0: sagittal; 1:\
1668            coronal; 2: axial.
1669        lock: Set whether view is locked to image axes (0: no, 1: yes).
1670        select_image: Switch to image number specified, with reference to the\
1671            list of currently loaded images.
1672        autoscale: Reset the image scaling to automatically determined range.
1673        interpolation: Enable or disable image interpolation in main image.
1674        colourmap: Switch the image colourmap to that specified, as per the\
1675            colourmap menu.
1676        noannotations: Hide all image annotation overlays.
1677        comments: Show or hide image comments overlay.
1678        voxelinfo: Show or hide voxel information overlay.
1679        orientationlabel: Show or hide orientation label overlay.
1680        colourbar: Show or hide colourbar overlay.
1681        imagevisible: Show or hide the main image.
1682        intensity_range: Set the image intensity range to that specified.
1683        size: Set the size of the view area, in pixel units.
1684        position: Set the position of the main window, in pixel units.
1685        fullscreen: Start fullscreen.
1686        exit_: Quit MRView.
1687        sync_focus: Sync the focus with other MRView windows that also have\
1688            this turned on.
1689        fps: Display frames per second, averaged over the last 10 frames. The\
1690            maximum over the last 3 seconds is also displayed.
1691        overlay_load: Loads the specified image on the overlay tool.
1692        overlay_opacity: Sets the overlay opacity to floating value [0-1].
1693        overlay_colourmap: Sets the colourmap of the overlay as indexed in the\
1694            colourmap dropdown menu.
1695        overlay_colour: Specify a manual colour for the overlay, as three\
1696            comma-separated values.
1697        overlay_intensity: Set the intensity windowing of the overlay.
1698        overlay_threshold_min: Set the lower threshold value of the overlay.
1699        overlay_threshold_max: Set the upper threshold value of the overlay.
1700        overlay_no_threshold_min: Disable the lower threshold for the overlay.
1701        overlay_no_threshold_max: Disable the upper threshold for the overlay.
1702        overlay_interpolation: Enable or disable overlay image interpolation.
1703        roi_load: Loads the specified image on the ROI editor tool.
1704        roi_opacity: Sets the overlay opacity to floating value [0-1].
1705        roi_colour: Sets the colour of the ROI overlay.
1706        tractography_load: Load the specified tracks file into the tractography\
1707            tool.
1708        tractography_thickness: Line thickness of tractography display, [-1.0,\
1709            1.0], default is 0.0.
1710        tractography_geometry: The geometry type to use when rendering\
1711            tractograms (options are: pseudotubes, lines, points).
1712        tractography_opacity: Opacity of tractography display, [0.0, 1.0],\
1713            default is 1.0.
1714        tractography_slab: Slab thickness of tractography display, in mm. -1 to\
1715            turn off crop to slab.
1716        tractography_lighting: Toggle the use of lighting of tractogram\
1717            geometry.
1718        tractography_colour: Specify a manual colour for the tractogram, as\
1719            three comma-separated values.
1720        tractography_tsf_load: Load the specified tractography scalar file.
1721        tractography_tsf_range: Set range for the tractography scalar file.\
1722            Requires -tractography.tsf_load already provided.
1723        tractography_tsf_thresh: Set thresholds for the tractography scalar\
1724            file. Requires -tractography.tsf_load already provided.
1725        tractography_tsf_colourmap: Sets the colourmap of the .tsf file as\
1726            indexed in the tsf colourmap dropdown menu. Requires\
1727            -tractography.tsf_load already.
1728        odf_load_sh: Loads the specified SH-based ODF image on the ODF tool.
1729        odf_load_tensor: Loads the specified tensor image on the ODF tool.
1730        odf_load_dixel: Loads the specified dixel-based image on the ODF tool.
1731        fixel_load: Load a fixel file (any file inside a fixel directory, or an\
1732            old .msf / .msh legacy format file) into the fixel tool.
1733        connectome_init: Initialise the connectome tool using a parcellation\
1734            image.
1735        connectome_load: Load a matrix file into the connectome tool.
1736        capture_folder: Set the output folder for the screen capture tool.
1737        capture_prefix: Set the output file prefix for the screen capture tool.
1738        capture_grab: Start the screen capture process.
1739        info: display information messages.
1740        quiet: do not display information messages or progress status;\
1741            alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET\
1742            environment variable to a non-empty string.
1743        debug: display debugging messages.
1744        force: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as\
1745            input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).
1746        nthreads: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications\
1747            (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).
1748        config: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.
1749        help_: display this information page and exit.
1750        version: display version information and exit.
1751        runner: Command runner.
1752    Returns:
1753        NamedTuple of outputs (described in `MrviewOutputs`).
1754    """
1755    runner = runner or get_global_runner()
1756    execution = runner.start_execution(MRVIEW_METADATA)
1757    cargs = []
1758    cargs.append("mrview")
1759    if mode is not None:

1610    help_: bool = False,
1611    version: bool = False,
1612    runner: Runner | None = None,
1613) -> MrviewOutputs:
1614    """
1615    mrview by J-Donald Tournier (jdtournier@gmail.com), Dave Raffelt
1616    (david.raffelt@florey.edu.au), Robert E. Smith (robert.smith@florey.edu.au),
1617    Rami Tabbara (rami.tabbara@florey.edu.au), Max Pietsch
1618    (maximilian.pietsch@kcl.ac.uk), Thijs Dhollander (thijs.dhollander@gmail.com).
1619    
1620    The MRtrix image viewer.
1621    
1622    Any images listed as arguments will be loaded and available through the
1623    image menu, with the first listed displayed initially. Any subsequent
1624    command-line options will be processed as if the corresponding action had
1625    been performed through the GUI.
1626    
1627    Note that because images loaded as arguments (i.e. simply listed on the
1628    command-line) are opened before the GUI is shown, subsequent actions to be
1629    performed via the various command-line options must appear after the last
1630    argument. This is to avoid confusion about which option will apply to which
1631    image. If you need fine control over this, please use the -load or
1632    -select_image options. For example:
1633    
1634    $ mrview -load image1.mif -interpolation 0 -load image2.mif -interpolation 0
1635    
1636    or
1637    
1638    $ mrview image1.mif image2.mif -interpolation 0 -select_image 2
1639    -interpolation 0
1640    
1641    References:
1642    
1643    Tournier, J.-D.; Calamante, F. & Connelly, A. MRtrix: Diffusion tractography
1644    in crossing fiber regions. Int. J. Imaging Syst. Technol., 2012, 22, 53-66.
1645    
1646    More information:
1647    https://mrtrix.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/commands/mrview.html
1648    
1649    Args:
1650        image: An image to be loaded.
1651        mode: Switch to view mode specified by the integer index, as per the\
1652            view menu.
1653        load: Load image specified and make it current.
1654        reset: Reset the view according to current image. This resets the FOV,\

1656        fov: Set the field of view, in mm.

1669            coronal; 2: axial.
1670        lock: Set whether view is locked to image axes (0: no, 1: yes).
1671        select_image: Switch to image number specified, with reference to the\
1672            list of currently loaded images.
1673        autoscale: Reset the image scaling to automatically determined range.
1674        interpolation: Enable or disable image interpolation in main image.
1675        colourmap: Switch the image colourmap to that specified, as per the\
1676            colourmap menu.
1677        noannotations: Hide all image annotation overlays.
1678        comments: Show or hide image comments overlay.
1679        voxelinfo: Show or hide voxel information overlay.
1680        orientationlabel: Show or hide orientation label overlay.
1681        colourbar: Show or hide colourbar overlay.
1682        imagevisible: Show or hide the main image.
1683        intensity_range: Set the image intensity range to that specified.
1684        size: Set the size of the view area, in pixel units.
1685        position: Set the position of the main window, in pixel units.
1686        fullscreen: Start fullscreen.
1687        exit_: Quit MRView.
1688        sync_focus: Sync the focus with other MRView windows that also have\
1689            this turned on.

1691            maximum over the last 3 seconds is also displayed.

1693        overlay_opacity: Sets the overlay opacity to floating value [0-1].
1694        overlay_colourmap: Sets the colourmap of the overlay as indexed in the\
1695            colourmap dropdown menu.
1696        overlay_colour: Specify a manual colour for the overlay, as three\

1698        overlay_intensity: Set the intensity windowing of the overlay.
1699        overlay_threshold_min: Set the lower threshold value of the overlay.
1700        overlay_threshold_max: Set the upper threshold value of the overlay.
1701        overlay_no_threshold_min: Disable the lower threshold for the overlay.
1702        overlay_no_threshold_max: Disable the upper threshold for the overlay.
1703        overlay_interpolation: Enable or disable overlay image interpolation.
1704        roi_load: Loads the specified image on the ROI editor tool.
1705        roi_opacity: Sets the overlay opacity to floating value [0-1].
1706        roi_colour: Sets the colour of the ROI overlay.
1707        tractography_load: Load the specified tracks file into the tractography\
1708            tool.
1709        tractography_thickness: Line thickness of tractography display, [-1.0,\
1710            1.0], default is 0.0.
1711        tractography_geometry: The geometry type to use when rendering\
1712            tractograms (options are: pseudotubes, lines, points).
1713        tractography_opacity: Opacity of tractography display, [0.0, 1.0],\
1714            default is 1.0.
1715        tractography_slab: Slab thickness of tractography display, in mm. -1 to\
1716            turn off crop to slab.
1717        tractography_lighting: Toggle the use of lighting of tractogram\
1718            geometry.
1719        tractography_colour: Specify a manual colour for the tractogram, as\
1720            three comma-separated values.
1721        tractography_tsf_load: Load the specified tractography scalar file.
1722        tractography_tsf_range: Set range for the tractography scalar file.\
1723            Requires -tractography.tsf_load already provided.
1724        tractography_tsf_thresh: Set thresholds for the tractography scalar\
1725            file. Requires -tractography.tsf_load already provided.
1726        tractography_tsf_colourmap: Sets the colourmap of the .tsf file as\
1727            indexed in the tsf colourmap dropdown menu. Requires\
1728            -tractography.tsf_load already.
1729        odf_load_sh: Loads the specified SH-based ODF image on the ODF tool.
1730        odf_load_tensor: Loads the specified tensor image on the ODF tool.
1731        odf_load_dixel: Loads the specified dixel-based image on the ODF tool.
1732        fixel_load: Load a fixel file (any file inside a fixel directory, or an\
1733            old .msf / .msh legacy format file) into the fixel tool.
1734        connectome_init: Initialise the connectome tool using a parcellation\
1735            image.
1736        connectome_load: Load a matrix file into the connectome tool.
1737        capture_folder: Set the output folder for the screen capture tool.
1738        capture_prefix: Set the output file prefix for the screen capture tool.
1739        capture_grab: Start the screen capture process.
1740        info: display information messages.
1741        quiet: do not display information messages or progress status;\
1742            alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET\
1743            environment variable to a non-empty string.
1744        debug: display debugging messages.
1745        force: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as\
1746            input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).
1747        nthreads: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications\
1748            (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).
1749        config: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.
1750        help_: display this information page and exit.
1751        version: display version information and exit.
1752        runner: Command runner.
1753    Returns:
1754        NamedTuple of outputs (described in `MrviewOutputs`).
1755    """
1756    runner = runner or get_global_runner()
1757    execution = runner.start_execution(MRVIEW_METADATA)
1758    cargs = []
1759    cargs.append("mrview")
1760    if mode is not None:
1761        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in mode] for a in c])
1762    if load is not None:
1763        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in load] for a in c])

1767        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in fov] for a in c])

1769        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in focus] for a in c])
1770    if target is not None:
1771        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in target] for a in c])
1772    if voxel is not None:
1773        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in voxel] for a in c])
1774    if volume is not None:
1775        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in volume] for a in c])
1776    if plane is not None:
1777        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in plane] for a in c])
1778    if lock is not None:
1779        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in lock] for a in c])
1780    if select_image is not None:
1781        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in select_image] for a in c])
1782    if autoscale is not None:
1783        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in autoscale] for a in c])
1784    if interpolation is not None:
1785        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in interpolation] for a in c])
1786    if colourmap is not None:
1787        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in colourmap] for a in c])
1788    if noannotations is not None:
1789        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in noannotations] for a in c])
1790    if comments is not None:
1791        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in comments] for a in c])
1792    if voxelinfo is not None:
1793        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in voxelinfo] for a in c])
1794    if orientationlabel is not None:
1795        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in orientationlabel] for a in c])
1796    if colourbar is not None:
1797        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in colourbar] for a in c])
1798    if imagevisible is not None:
1799        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in imagevisible] for a in c])
1800    if intensity_range is not None:
1801        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in intensity_range] for a in c])
1802    if size is not None:
1803        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in size] for a in c])

1872    if connectome_load is not None:

1876    if capture_prefix is not None:

1878    if capture_grab is not None:
1879        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in capture_grab] for a in c])
1880    if info:

1884    if debug:
1885        cargs.append("-debug")
1886    if force:
1887        cargs.append("-force")
1888    if nthreads is not None:
1889        cargs.extend(["-nthreads", str(nthreads)])
1890    if config is not None:
1891        cargs.extend([a for c in [s.run(execution) for s in config] for a in c])
1892    if help_:
1893        cargs.append("-help")
1894    if version:
1895        cargs.append("-version")
1896    if image is not None:
1897        cargs.extend([execution.input_file(f) for f in image])
1898    ret = MrviewOutputs(
1899        root=execution.output_file("."),
1900    )
1901    execution.run(cargs)
1902    return ret

mrview by J-Donald Tournier (jdtournier@gmail.com), Dave Raffelt (david.raffelt@florey.edu.au), Robert E. Smith (robert.smith@florey.edu.au), Rami Tabbara (rami.tabbara@florey.edu.au), Max Pietsch (maximilian.pietsch@kcl.ac.uk), Thijs Dhollander (thijs.dhollander@gmail.com).

The MRtrix image viewer.

Any images listed as arguments will be loaded and available through the image menu, with the first listed displayed initially. Any subsequent command-line options will be processed as if the corresponding action had been performed through the GUI.

Note that because images loaded as arguments (i.e. simply listed on the command-line) are opened before the GUI is shown, subsequent actions to be performed via the various command-line options must appear after the last argument. This is to avoid confusion about which option will apply to which image. If you need fine control over this, please use the -load or -select_image options. For example:

$ mrview -load image1.mif -interpolation 0 -load image2.mif -interpolation 0

or

$ mrview image1.mif image2.mif -interpolation 0 -select_image 2 -interpolation 0

References:

Tournier, J.-D.; Calamante, F. & Connelly, A. MRtrix: Diffusion tractography in crossing fiber regions. Int. J. Imaging Syst. Technol., 2012, 22, 53-66.

More information: https://mrtrix.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/commands/mrview.html

Arguments:
  • image: An image to be loaded.
  • mode: Switch to view mode specified by the integer index, as per the view menu.
  • load: Load image specified and make it current.
  • reset: Reset the view according to current image. This resets the FOV, projection and focus.
  • fov: Set the field of view, in mm.
  • focus: Either set the position of the crosshairs in scanner coordinates, with the new position supplied as a comma-separated list of floating-point values or show or hide the focus cross hair using a boolean value as argument.
  • target: Set the target location for the viewing window (the scanner coordinate that will appear at the centre of the viewing window.
  • voxel: Set the position of the crosshairs in voxel coordinates, relative the image currently displayed. The new position should be supplied as a comma-separated list of floating-point values.
  • volume: Set the volume index for the image displayed, as a comma-separated list of integers.
  • plane: Set the viewing plane, according to the mappping 0: sagittal; 1: coronal; 2: axial.
  • lock: Set whether view is locked to image axes (0: no, 1: yes).
  • select_image: Switch to image number specified, with reference to the list of currently loaded images.
  • autoscale: Reset the image scaling to automatically determined range.
  • interpolation: Enable or disable image interpolation in main image.
  • colourmap: Switch the image colourmap to that specified, as per the colourmap menu.
  • noannotations: Hide all image annotation overlays.
  • comments: Show or hide image comments overlay.
  • voxelinfo: Show or hide voxel information overlay.
  • orientationlabel: Show or hide orientation label overlay.
  • colourbar: Show or hide colourbar overlay.
  • imagevisible: Show or hide the main image.
  • intensity_range: Set the image intensity range to that specified.
  • size: Set the size of the view area, in pixel units.
  • position: Set the position of the main window, in pixel units.
  • fullscreen: Start fullscreen.
  • exit_: Quit MRView.
  • sync_focus: Sync the focus with other MRView windows that also have this turned on.
  • fps: Display frames per second, averaged over the last 10 frames. The maximum over the last 3 seconds is also displayed.
  • overlay_load: Loads the specified image on the overlay tool.
  • overlay_opacity: Sets the overlay opacity to floating value [0-1].
  • overlay_colourmap: Sets the colourmap of the overlay as indexed in the colourmap dropdown menu.
  • overlay_colour: Specify a manual colour for the overlay, as three comma-separated values.
  • overlay_intensity: Set the intensity windowing of the overlay.
  • overlay_threshold_min: Set the lower threshold value of the overlay.
  • overlay_threshold_max: Set the upper threshold value of the overlay.
  • overlay_no_threshold_min: Disable the lower threshold for the overlay.
  • overlay_no_threshold_max: Disable the upper threshold for the overlay.
  • overlay_interpolation: Enable or disable overlay image interpolation.
  • roi_load: Loads the specified image on the ROI editor tool.
  • roi_opacity: Sets the overlay opacity to floating value [0-1].
  • roi_colour: Sets the colour of the ROI overlay.
  • tractography_load: Load the specified tracks file into the tractography tool.
  • tractography_thickness: Line thickness of tractography display, [-1.0, 1.0], default is 0.0.
  • tractography_geometry: The geometry type to use when rendering tractograms (options are: pseudotubes, lines, points).
  • tractography_opacity: Opacity of tractography display, [0.0, 1.0], default is 1.0.
  • tractography_slab: Slab thickness of tractography display, in mm. -1 to turn off crop to slab.
  • tractography_lighting: Toggle the use of lighting of tractogram geometry.
  • tractography_colour: Specify a manual colour for the tractogram, as three comma-separated values.
  • tractography_tsf_load: Load the specified tractography scalar file.
  • tractography_tsf_range: Set range for the tractography scalar file. Requires -tractography.tsf_load already provided.
  • tractography_tsf_thresh: Set thresholds for the tractography scalar file. Requires -tractography.tsf_load already provided.
  • tractography_tsf_colourmap: Sets the colourmap of the .tsf file as indexed in the tsf colourmap dropdown menu. Requires -tractography.tsf_load already.
  • odf_load_sh: Loads the specified SH-based ODF image on the ODF tool.
  • odf_load_tensor: Loads the specified tensor image on the ODF tool.
  • odf_load_dixel: Loads the specified dixel-based image on the ODF tool.
  • fixel_load: Load a fixel file (any file inside a fixel directory, or an old .msf / .msh legacy format file) into the fixel tool.
  • connectome_init: Initialise the connectome tool using a parcellation image.
  • connectome_load: Load a matrix file into the connectome tool.
  • capture_folder: Set the output folder for the screen capture tool.
  • capture_prefix: Set the output file prefix for the screen capture tool.
  • capture_grab: Start the screen capture process.
  • info: display information messages.
  • quiet: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.
  • debug: display debugging messages.
  • force: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).
  • nthreads: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).
  • config: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.
  • help_: display this information page and exit.
  • version: display version information and exit.
  • runner: Command runner.
Returns:

NamedTuple of outputs (described in MrviewOutputs).
